2 import rospy
3 
4 from .robot_status_enums import *
5 
6 # - Messages
7 from rosgraph_msgs.msg import Log
8 
9 
10 class RobotLogsObserver(object):
11 
12  def __init__(self, robot_status_handler):
13  """
14 
15  :type robot_status_handler: RobotStatusHandler
16  """
17  self.__robot_status_handler = robot_status_handler
18 
19  self.__log_nodes = rospy.get_param("~node_logs")
20  self.__log_status = LOG_LEVEL_TO_MSG[Log.INFO]
21  self.__log_msg = ""
22 
23  # - Subscribers
24  self.__log_sub = rospy.Subscriber('/rosout_agg', Log, self.__callback_logs)
25 
26  def __callback_logs(self, msg):
27  if msg.name in self.__log_nodes:
28  if msg.level in [Log.WARN, Log.ERROR, Log.FATAL]:
29  # Filter out warnings that don't matter
30  if msg.level == Log.WARN and "Inbound TCP/IP connection failed" in msg.msg:
31  return
32 
33  self.__log_msg = 'level: {}\nnode: {}\nmsg: {}\nfile: {}\nfunction: {}\nline: {}\n' \
34  ''.format(LOG_LEVEL_TO_STR[msg.level], msg.name, msg.msg,
35  msg.file, msg.function, msg.line)
36 
37  elif self.__log_status == LOG_LEVEL_TO_MSG[msg.level]:
38  self.__log_msg = ""
39  return
40 
41  self.__log_status = LOG_LEVEL_TO_MSG[msg.level]
42  self.__robot_status_handler.advertise_new_logs()
43 
44  @property
45  def log_status(self):
46  return self.__log_status
47 
48  @property
49  def log_message(self):
50  return self.__log_msg
